page.content: {1577 Edmund Scrambler(Bishop of { Peterborough at that time)granted { Southorpehall and the southern { part of Tomlynson's woods to the { Queen of Southorpe who granted { all this to Lord Burghley.The { area now belongs to a decsendant { of the Marquis of Exeter. {1500's The Manor of Torpel went into { the hands of the holders of the { Manor at Walcot. {1847 The Hamlet of Southorpe was { transfered to the parish of { Barnack . {1849 After the dissolution of the { monastries Southorpehall was { given to the Abbots of { Peterborough to be used as the { Summer resident. {1876 Bishop Scrambler surrendered the { mansion to the Crown. {1877 Southorpehall was granted to Lord
